chinese: 1.旅游业
english: tourism

chinese: 旅游业是指给度假者提供服务的行业。
english: Tourism is the business of providing services for people on holiday

chinese: adi奢华的；铺张浪费的 以.浪费；慷慨给予
english: lavish

chinese: 客厅的装修可真是奢华。
english: The decoration of the living room is so lavish

chinese: 几.威严；尊严；端庄
english: dignity

chinese: 国王端坐在那里浑身透着王者的威严。
english: The king sat there with such regal dignity

chinese: 1.繁殖
english: propagation

chinese: 植物通过茎插很容易进行繁殖。
english: Vegetative propagation is easy to initiate from stem cuttings

chinese: 加.众多；群众1聚集
english: mass

chinese: 一大群人在等待。
english: A mass of people are waiting

chinese: n.困境Y宣誓，保证
english: plight

chinese: 在海上漂流好几天后仍未获救，他陷入了绝望的困境。
english: Drifting on the sea for days without rescue, he fell into a desperate plight

chinese: n. 跛行 vi.一瘸一拐地走，跛行
english: limp

chinese: 自从他被车撞后，他走路就一瘸一拐的。
english: Ever since he was hit by a car, he's walked with a limp

chinese: n.声誉
english: reputation

chinese: 因为经常赢得比赛，所以他在体育圈里有很高的声誉。
english: He has a good reputation among sportsmen since he always wins

chinese: n.马拉松赛跑adi！ 漫长而累人的 v.参加马拉松赛跑
english: marathon

chinese: 你需要拥有超乎常人的耐力才能贏得马拉松比赛。
english: To win a marathon, you need superhuman endurance levels

chinese: n. 意大利面食
english: pasta

chinese: 桌子上放着各种各样的意大利面食。
english: There are various kinds of pasta on the table

chinese: n.宽大
english: leniency

chinese: 被告十分感激对自己的宽大处理。
english: The leniency of the sentence was gratefully received by the defendant

chinese: adj.肥沃的
english: fertile

chinese: 奶牛的粪便让土地更肥沃了。
english: The dung of cows makes the land more fertile

chinese: v认出；识别出：确定，鉴定
english: identify

chinese: 他依靠对那件事的模糊记忆认出了窃贼。
english: He was able to identify the burglar from his vague memory of the incident

chinese: adj.人造的
english: artificial

chinese: 尽管有一条假肢，他依然可以跑赢你。
english: Even with an artificial leg, he can still beat you in a race

chinese: n，班轮，班机；眼线笔；内衬
english: liner

chinese: 你可以乘坐远洋班轮去旅行。
english: You can take a trip by ocean liner

chinese: n.（尤指崖边）边缘
english: brink

chinese: 站在悬崖边上的时候要小心，你可能会跌下
english: Be careful on the brink, you might fall off
